channel.title: Is this good to host with?
channel.description:
Wanted to post this in Server help, it said not to in the rules... I don't want to post in the dead topic "All questions blah VPSes".
Would I be better off hosting on a computer with 4GB of RAM, purchased in 2008 or 2009? Really fast computer, it got a virus, not [i]as[/i] fast as before, but still fast. Should I get a VPS of um.. maybe 512MB of RAM or a 1GB? My server has 40+ on weekdays, sometimes 70 - 100 on weekends, rarely 90+. It's PI... Should I continue hosting with the 4GB of RAM one or pay $25 per month for a 1GB one? I might get Linux if I understand how to use it. Never used a Linux, never used a VPS. Also if you could recommend a VPS site that would help me, I heard VPSLand is shit, I won't buy from there.

item.title: Is this good to host with?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

All right. I installed Ubuntu onto a disk. It took a few hours, I had to keep switching computers. MY computer would never finish downloading it. My laptop wouldn’t finish downloading it either. They both would stop 10 minutes into the downloading… Never finished. My mom’s incredible (or what I think is incredible…) computer downloaded it in 5 minutes. So I downloaded it then burned it onto 2 disks (1 extra in case I lose the old one). I went onto my brother’s computer (he doesn’t give a shit about it, my dad calls it a piece of shit and could care less if it gets a virus - just because it’s really slow (from 2001)) and uninstalled windows (I have a restore DVD in case I want to restore the computer back to windows) and put in the Ubuntu installation disk. It installed. I’m using the computer right now to type this message. I’m trying to install Java on it… but I’m having a rough time. Ubuntu compared to Windows on this computer is 1000x better. Windows would freeze a lot and make screeching noises from my computer… and it was loud as fuck. This thing is now silent – Okay that was a bit off topic.
What I’m trying to say is, I’m having trouble installing Java. I’m reading off of this tutorial of how to run a server on Linux.
I’m stuck on part 3. It says, “As you can see at the Top there is a taskbar very similar to Windows Task Bar. You need to click on “Applications” then “Accessories” and Finally “Terminal”” — Understand that part.

Next part: "Before we download and install Java we need to make your the “Repository” (a place were a lot of cool programs are held) is up to date. First of all we need to check that the server settings are correct to do this we need to type:

sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list" — Did that. Simple…

Next part: "[i]This will open gedit (Like Notepad) you need to make sure the following lines are included:

deb http://za.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ intrepid main restricted deb http://za.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ intrepid multiverse[/i]" – It says make sure they’re included. I don’t have those included. It doesn’t tell me what to do if they aren’t added. Out of common sense you’d add them. I did that, continued to the next part, got an error, tried installing Java off the website, turns out the installer doesn’t know how to be opened.

If somebody can show me how to do this over Teamviewer or something that would help a lot. Thanks.

Edit: I think I have Java installed. Don’t really know… I can’t open .JAR files for ‘Security reasons’. I don’t know how to run my server. I still need help, if anybody can help me make a .sh file that would help. I downloaded Wine.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this good to host with?

item.title: Is this good to host with?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Your computer doesn’t matter as much as your internet connection, you probably don’t have a fast enough one at home, because for a server you need to be concerned about upload speed.

Read full topic

They way I’ve always done it is just gone out and bought a Linux magazine with the newest Ubuntu in it, no need to download and the magazine should explain how to install it aswell.

item.source: Is this good to host with?

item.title: Is this good to host with?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

^ What do I do? Cancel the installation and retry?

Edit. Cancelled the installation, I’m going to retry. What settings do I use?

Installation size: 17GB (default), should I change this to something different?
Desktop environment: Ubuntu (default), does this need to be changed?

There’s an Accessibility option.
Says this in the Visibility section:
Visibility Aids
-Visibility1
-Visibility2
-Visibility3
-Braille

There’s also a Mobility section, it says:
[b]- Mobility Aids

  • Mobility1
  • Mobility2
  • None (selected, default)[/b]

What do I do :s?

Read full topic

item.title: Is this good to host with?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:13, topic:390844”]All right. All my files on Windows are completely separated from Ubuntu, right?

Also, should I cancel & retry the install? It’s been stuck at the same thing for about 20 minutes. It says:

Downloading lucid-desktop-amd64.iso
Remaining tim approximately 19min 50s

Again, it hasn’t moved for around 20 minutes.[/quote]

It’s not a 5 minute job, bare in mind you’re installing a completely new OS. and yes, all your windows files are separate.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this good to host with?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:11, topic:390844”]I’m installing Ubuntu right now…
If I restarted my computer, what would happen? After it’s done installing, of course.
Would I boot up in Windows or Ubuntu/Linux/Whatever I’m installing?[/quote]

You will get what’s called a dual boot screen, you will be able to select which OS.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this good to host with?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:7, topic:390844”]You’re best starting of with Ubuntu, which is a Linux distribution. You can find the windows installed at

http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop/get-ubuntu/windows-installer

Fat cookies wrote a tutorial on how to setup a server on Ubuntu. You also get a dual boot screen where you can select what OS you boot on startup.

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,367407.0.html[/quote]
This++

Ubuntu wins.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this good to host with?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“mark033, post:4, topic:390844”]Well how well does it cope with 100 people now? It’s not like you have to pick to either use the computer or the VPS and that’s it. If you pick one now you can always swap to the other.

If you need help setting up Java and running a server on Linux I (along with plenty of other people on these forums alone I’m sure) can help you.[/quote]

It lags … not really bad, it’s just hard to pk, the players would lag (not disconnect, just freeze for a second) about every 2 mins. If you could help me setup Java that would be great

cane:

You should just install linux over the current OS and that would be fine for your server

Can you show me a download link? And would I be able to chose from Windows and Linux on startup?

Read full topic
